name: People's Pizza
notes: A satisfying pizza with good company

name: King of Pizza
notes: Crust too thick

name: Bistro Pizzeria
notes: Like really good bowling alley pizza. Thin. Crust very good.

name: Nicky B's
notes: The couple slices that were greasier were better. Otherwise, mediocre pizza.

name: Tony's Pizza
notes: A bit too saucy for me but I liked the crust a lot.

name: Pronto Pizza
notes: No masks

name: House of Pizza
notes: Good crust but like no oil, wtf!!!

name: Antonino's
notes: amazing from the first bite. Truly stuffed after eating

name: Joe's Pizza
notes: Was very hungry but I think it was still pretty great. The oil was great but needed more spread out. Crust was my fave

name: Nicky B's
notes: Ooops. We ate it twice. Perfect greasy levels. Fillings. Cheese is great.

name: Genova's
notes: No puddles = no oil = not as good but something special about crust

name: Pepperoni Pizza
notes: Definitely one of the best. Great crust. Good thickness of cheese.

name: Nick and Joes
notes: Goodness. I hope that was a fluke. Not the pizza I remember. Kinda overcooked.

name: Brooklyn Pizza
notes: I think I was expected to love this one (being Brooklyn and all) but I wasn't that impressed. It was good but I think the sauce overpowered the cheese and I'm way more of a cheese person than sauce.

name: Toscana's
notes: I only ate 4 slices because the crust was the majority of the pie that you had to to fulfill your appetite!

name: Villa Barone
notes: Crust was good. Players in the pizza game. Not just a restaurant.

name: Tacconelli's
notes: Through no fault of resturant was not hot. Ordered extra cheese but definiteluy didn't get it. So while it was good, disappoiinted.

name: People's Pizza
notes: Consistent coloring. Basic but very satisying crust/sauce/cheese. Nothing fancy but not lacking either.

name: King of Pizza
notes: Cash only. Looked amazing at first glance, but wasn't as good as I hoped. Crust is a little too thick, but I liked the cheese.

name: Bistro Pizzeria
notes: Better than I expected. Needed about 50% more sauce. Crust was excellent and the pizza was cooked perfectly, but lack of sauce dried it out a little for me. Would eat a slice there any day.

name: Nicky B's
notes: Nice flavor in the sauce, but the crust wasnt doing it for me. I like when they include the tiny 3 leg table.

name: Tony's Pizza
notes: Saucy, which I like. Crust was surprisingly good. It was salty and had a nice chew. Finished 4 slices easily, since it was thin. Would go there again.

name: Pronto Pizza
notes: Not enough sauce or masks.

name: House of Pizza
notes: Crust tasted great, but was almost too thin. Would have been better with thin crust and more cheese, but overall didn't feel substantial enough. Felt cheaply made, but definitely hit the spot.

name: Antonino's
notes: Perfect balance of cheese and crust and cooked exactly the right amount of time. Crust tasted and felt great. Very substantial slices (could feed 3 or even 4 people). No way this isn't in our final top 3.

name: Joe's Pizza
notes: Nearly perfect. First bite was as good as the last. Crust and sauce hit exactly like they should. I need to order another one just to make sure this wasn't a fluke.

name: Bruno's
notes: Very good. First bite was salty and perfect. Could have used a little more cheese, but really enjoyed it. Reminded me of the pizza joints of my childhood (Scottos in Berlin, or Nino's in Hammonton)

name: Genova's
notes: I liked the garlic in the sauce, but could have used more cheese and another minute or two in the oven. Crust was made with love.

name: Pepperoni Pizza
notes: Fantastic pizza. Balanced and cooked perfectly. Crust was the star and had the right amount of chew/flavor. Salad was excellent, too. Watched the Many Saints of Newark while we ate it, so maybe that helped.

name: Nick and Joes
notes: Ovrcooked. Pretty disappointed because I've had good pizza here in the past. The mozarella sticks were good.

name: Brooklyn Pizza
notes: Crust and sauce are incredible. Would give the crust a 6 if I could. I could only eat 3 slices because the pizza was so substantial.

name: Toscana's
notes: It's pizza. First bit was surprisingly good, but mostly downhill after that. Ate 4 slices easily because it was think. Maybe a tiny bit over cooked and could have used more cheese.

name: Villa Barone
notes: Lots of love goes into this pizza. Garlic. Basil. Great pizza.

name: Tacconelli's
notes: It might be unfair to judge this pizza. We should've eaten it straight out of the oven but it's not OUR fault they haven't opened Haddon Twp location yet.
